headline: January 6 Committee Says Trump May Have Engaged Criminal Conduct
summary: The House's select Jan. 6 Committee says it has evidence that former President Donald Trump and his campaign team engaged in criminal conduct in their attempts tooverturn the results of the 2020 presidential election.The findings, which were made public late Wednesday in a 61-pagecourt filingby the mostly Democratic committee, included excerpts of numerous depositions from top aides to Trump and then-Vice President Mike Pence. The findings were released as part of the committee's efforts to obtain critical emails from John Eastman, an attorney who was involved in Trump's strategy topersuade Pence to refuse to certify the Electoral College results.  Eastman so far has claimed attorney-client privilege.A judge overseeing the civil lawsuit would review the emails to decide if they should stay protected, since the House cannot bring criminal charges.  The committee will, however, consider passing along any evidence of criminal conduct by Trump or his campaign team to the U.S. Justice Department.  This symbolic criminal referral would increase political pressure on Attorney General Merrick Garland to charge the former president.
